Title: 1. Vertigo
description: A former San Francisco police detective juggles wrestling with his personal demons and becoming obsessed with the hauntingly beautiful woman he has been hired to trail, who may be deeply disturbed.

Title: 2. Touch of Evil
description: A Mexican official and his American wife are targeted in a Texas border town by the crime family he's trying to put behind bars for drug trafficking, as his concern grows over the tactics of the local detective whose cooperation he needs.

Title: 3. South Pacific
description: On a South Pacific island during World War II, love blooms between a young nurse and a secretive Frenchman who's being courted for a dangerous military mission.

Title: 4. Elevator to the Gallows
description: A self-assured businessman murders his employer, the husband of his mistress, which unintentionally provokes an ill-fated chain of events.

Title: 5. The Hidden Fortress
description: Lured by gold, two greedy peasants unknowingly escort a princess and her general across enemy lines.

Title: 6. Inspector Maigret
description: In the Marais district in central Paris, somebody is going round murdering young women. Maigret is called to investigate.

Title: 7. The Big Country
description: A New England sea captain in the 1880s arrives at his fiancée's sprawling Texas ranch, where he becomes embroiled in a feud between two families over a valuable patch of land.

Title: 8. Hell, Heaven or Hoboken
description: During World War II, a British actor impersonates Field Marshal Montgomery in order to confuse German intelligence.

Title: 9. The Vikings
description: A slave and a Viking prince fight for the love of a captive princess.

Title: 10. Separate Tables
description: The stories of several people are told as they stay at a seaside hotel in Bournemouth which features dining at "Separate Tables."

Title: 11. The Proud Rebel
description: A Confederate veteran living in the Yankee North struggles with his son's shock-induced muteness and the Northerners' hatred.

Title: 12. The Bravados
description: A man is chasing four outlaws who killed his wife and finds them in a small town's jail, but they escape to Mexico.

Title: 13. Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
description: Brick is an alcoholic ex-football player who drinks his days away and resists the affections of his wife. A reunion with his terminal father jogs a host of memories and revelations for both father and son.

Title: 14. Stage Struck
description: A young woman arrives in New York City determined to become a great theatrical star, but discovers that her goal may not be as easily attainable as she had hoped.

Title: 15. The Blob
description: An alien lifeform consumes everything in its path as it grows and grows.

Title: 16. Gigi
description: Weary of the conventions of Parisian society, a rich playboy and a youthful courtesan-in-training enjoy a platonic friendship which may not stay platonic for long.

Title: 17. Screaming Mimi
description: Virginia Wilson saw a man get shot right after he tried to kill her, so she goes to psychiatrist Dr. Greenwood. He falls in love with her and takes over her life, but she insists on continuing her career as a stripper.

Title: 18. A Night to Remember
description: On her maiden voyage in April 1912, the supposedly unsinkable RMS Titanic strikes an iceberg in the Atlantic Ocean.

Title: 19. Horror of Dracula
description: When Jonathan Harker rouses the ire of Count Dracula for accepting a job at the vampire's castle under false pretenses, his friend Dr. Van Helsing pursues the predatory villain.

Title: 20. The Long, Hot Summer
description: Accused barn burner and conman Ben Quick arrives in a small Mississippi town and quickly ingratiates himself with its richest family, the Varners.

Title: 21. The Fly
description: A scientist has a horrific accident when he tries to use his newly invented teleportation device.

Title: 22. The Young Lions
description: The lives of three young men, a German and two Americans, during WWII.

Title: 23. Bell Book and Candle
description: A modern-day witch likes her neighbor but despises his fiancée, so she enchants him to love her instead.

Title: 24. The Defiant Ones
description: Two chained-together escaped convicts, one white and one black, must learn to get along in order to elude capture.

Title: 25. The 7th Voyage of Sinbad
description: When a princess is shrunken by an evil wizard, Sinbad must undertake a quest to an island of monsters to cure her and prevent a war.

Title: 26. I Want to Live!
description: A prostitute sentenced to death for murder pleads her innocence.

Title: 27. Run Silent Run Deep
description: A U.S. submarine commander who's obsessed with sinking a particular Japanese ship butts heads with his first officer and crew.

Title: 28. My Uncle
description: Monsieur Hulot visits the technology-driven world of his sister, brother-in-law, and nephew, but he can't quite fit into the surroundings.

Title: 29. The Thing That Couldn't Die
description: A psychically gifted young woman discovers a centuries-old crate buried on her aunt's ranch. Opening it, her family discovers the living head of Gideon Drew, a 16th century devil worshiper who was beheaded by Sir Francis Drake.

Title: 30. Love Is My Profession
description: Married French lawyer Andre defends succesfully the case of Yvette, who committed a robbery. He falls in love with her, but she isn't true to him.

Title: 31. God's Little Acre
description: In the 1950s, a poor Georgia cotton farmer and his sons search for the gold presumably buried on the farm by their great-grandfather, but problems related to poverty, infidelity, unemployment, and booze threaten to destroy their family.

Title: 32. Auntie Mame
description: An orphan goes to live with his free-spirited aunt. Conflict ensues when the executor of his father's estate objects to the aunt's lifestyle.

Title: 33. The Toughest Gun in Tombstone
description: Matt Sloane is sent from Texas to Arizona to tame Tombstone where a gang of outlaws deals with cattle and silver. One of them killed his wife.

Title: 34. Bonjour Tristesse
description: Spoiled Cecile, 17, spends her summer at the French Riviera with her rich, widower, playboy dad and Elsa. Anne, her late mom's friend, visits and brings changes to all.

Title: 35. The Man Inside
description: A jeweler's bookkeeper steals a gem and kills someone while escaping to Europe, where he lives luxuriously and chases women. A detective follows his trail, realizing others are hunting him too, suggesting a deeper mystery.

Title: 36. Attack of the 50 Foot Woman
description: When an abused socialite grows to giant size because of an alien encounter and an aborted murder attempt, she goes after her cheating husband with revenge on her mind.

Title: 37. Houseboat
description: A widower, his three young children, and an Italian nanny get to know each other better when circumstances have them living together aboard a badly neglected houseboat.

Title: 38. Indiscreet
description: An actress who has given up on love meets a suave banker and begins a flirtation with him--although he's already married.

Title: 39. Ashes and Diamonds
description: As World War II and the German occupation ends, the Polish resistance and the Soviet forces turn on each other in an attempt to take over leadership in Communist Poland.

Title: 40. Room at the Top
description: An ambitious young accountant plots to wed a wealthy factory owner's daughter despite falling in love with a married older woman.

Title: 41. The Crawling Eye
description: A series of decapitations on a Swiss mountainside appear to be connected to a mysterious radioactive cloud.

Title: 42. Fiend Without a Face
description: A scientist's thoughts materialize as an army of invisible brain-shaped monsters (complete with spinal-cord tails!) who terrorize an American military base in this nightmarish chiller.

Title: 43. King Creole
description: A troubled youth's singing sets New Orleans rockin'. With a sweet girl to love him and nightclubbers cheering, it seems he will shake off his past and head for the top. But will a mobster and his man-trap moll snare him in a life of crime?

Title: 44. The Spider
description: Teenagers from a rural community and their high school science teacher join forces to battle a giant mutant spider.

Title: 45. Man from God's Country
description: A cattleman, through a deal with a friend, gets involved in a land-grab for a proposed railroad in Sundown, Montana in this classic Western starring George Montgomery.

Title: 46. The Old Man and the Sea
description: An old Cuban fisherman's dry spell is broken when he hooks a gigantic fish that drags him out to sea.

Title: 47. Thunder Road
description: A veteran comes home from the Korean War to the mountains and takes over the family moonshining business. He has to battle big-city gangsters who are trying to take over the business and the police who are trying to put him in prison.

Title: 48. Missile to the Moon
description: Escaped cons stowaway on a flight to the moon and discover alien women ruled by a sadistic queen.

Title: 49. Immer die Radfahrer
description: Three old friends are going on a cycle holiday, like they did 20 years ago.

Title: 50. The Brothers Karamazov
description: Drama based on Russian writer Fyodor Dostoevsky's homonymous novel about the proud Karamazov family in 1870s Russia.

Title: 51. Man of the West
description: A reformed outlaw becomes stranded after an aborted train robbery with two other passengers and is forced to rejoin his old outlaw band.

Title: 52. The Lineup
description: In San Francisco, a psychopathic gangster and his mentor retrieve heroin packages carried to the U. S. by unsuspecting overseas travelers.

Title: 53. The Naked and the Dead
description: Set during the Pacific War against the Japanese, this WW2 drama discerns between achieving one's mission at any cost versus preserving the lives under one's command and enforcing discipline through fear as opposed to mutual respect.

Title: 54. The Desperate Men
description: A GI deserter frames a girl for killing a blackmailer and holds her captive while seeking gems.

Title: 55. Shadows
description: Cassavetes' jazz-scored improvisational film explores interracial friendships and relationships in Beat-Era (1950s) New York City.

Title: 56. Some Came Running
description: A veteran returns home to deal with family secrets and small-town scandals.

Title: 57. Hercules
description: The muscular Hercules performs his Labors, sails with the Argonauts, and romances the fair Iole.

Title: 58. Damn Yankees
description: A frustrated fan of the hopeless Washington Senators makes a pact with the Devil to help the baseball team win the league pennant.

Title: 59. It! The Terror from Beyond Space
description: A mission sent to rescue the first manned expedition to Mars is invaded by an unknown life form, which stows away on the rescue ship.

Title: 60. Queen of Outer Space
description: American astronauts are drawn by a mysterious force to the planet Venus, which they find to be inhabited only by beautiful women and their despotic queen.

Title: 61. The Inn of the Sixth Happiness
description: A tenacious British woman becomes a missionary and runs an inn for travelling merchants in China during the Japanese invasion and the tumultuous years leading up to the Second World War.

Title: 62. Big Deal on Madonna Street
description: A motley quintet of inept small-time thieves attempt the burglary of a local pawnshop in this Italian farce.

Title: 63. Teacher's Pet
description: A hard-nosed newspaper editor poses as a night school student in order to woo a journalism teacher who cannot stand him.

Title: 64. Ice Cold in Alex
description: During World War II in North Africa, a medical field unit must cross the desert in their ambulance in order to reach the British lines in Alexandria.

Title: 65. The Two-Headed Spy
description: A long-entrenched British agent planted in the German Army is urged to continue his work during the Second World War, but struggles to keep secret his true identity from the Third Reich.

Title: 66. Rock-a-Bye Baby
description: A TV repair man must care for the newborn triplets of his former hometown sweetheart, now a famous movie star, so her career will not suffer.

Title: 67. No Time for Sergeants
description: Will Stockdale is a country bumpkin drafted into the Air Force and too dumb to realize he's driving everyone around him crazy, no one more than Sergeant King.

Title: 68. Gideon of Scotland Yard
description: A typical day for Scotland Yard Chief Inspector George Gideon consists of working on several cases at the same time.

Title: 69. A Tale of Two Cities
description: During the turbulent days of the French Revolution, Frenchwoman Lucie Manette falls in love with Englishman Charles Darnay, who's hiding his true identity and purpose.

Title: 70. Badman's Country
description: Showdown in Abilene between lawmen Pat Garrett, Wyatt Earp, Bat Masterson and Butch Cassidy's gang over a large shipment of money arriving by train.

Title: 71. The Lovers
description: Saddled with a dull husband and a foolish lover, a woman has an affair with a stranger.

Title: 72. Machine-Gun Kelly
description: The criminal exploits of Public Enemy number 1, George 'Machine-Gun' Kelly, during the 1930s.

Title: 73. A Time to Love and a Time to Die
description: On the Russian front in 1944, German private Ernst Graeber receives a leave and visits his family in Germany but Germany isn't the same country he left behind.

Title: 74. Hot Rod Gang
description: Kid who wants to enter his car in the drag races joins a rock band to make enough money to do it.

Title: 75. I Only Arsked!
description: Disgruntled soldiers posted to British-ruled Darawa unexpectedly find a secret entrance to the King's harem, complicating their mission.

Title: 76. Tom Thumb
description: A boy (Russ Tamblyn), no bigger than a thumb, manages to outwit two thieves (Terry-Thomas and Peter Sellers) determined to make a fortune from him.

Title: 77. Wild Heritage
description: Two westward-bound families join forces to battle gunslingers.

Title: 78. How to Make a Monster
description: When a master monster make-up artist is sacked by the new bosses of American International studios, he uses his creations to exact revenge.

Title: 79. The Goddess
description: A woman adored by the people around her ultimately struggles to be happy with herself.

Title: 80. Party Girl
description: Lawyer Tommy Farrell is a defender of crooks. Vicki Gaye encourages him to go straight, but mob king Rico Angelo insists otherwise.

Title: 81. Cowboy
description: An idealistic tenderfoot Chicago hotel clerk is taken on a cattle-drive to Mexico by famous trail boss Tom Reece but discovers that cowboy life isn't what he expected.

Title: 82. The Return of Dracula
description: After a vampire leaves his native Balkans, he murders a Czech artist, assumes his identity, and moves in with the dead man's American cousins.

Title: 83. Murder by Contract
description: Claude is a ruthless and efficient contract killer - until he finds his next target is a woman.

Title: 84. Night of the Blood Beast
description: An astronaut is killed on reentry to Earth, but his body is seeded with rapidly gestating aliens.

Title: 85. The Magician
description: A traveling magician and his assistants are persecuted by authorities in Sweden of the 19th century. Their capture, however, didn't bring victory to those in power.

Title: 86. Dunkirk
description: A dramatization of the British Expeditionary Force's 1940 retreat to the beaches of France and the extraordinary seaborne evacuation that saved it from utter destruction by Nazi Germany.

Title: 87. I Married a Monster from Outer Space
description: Aliens arrive on Earth to possess the bodies of humans. One of their first victims is a young man, whose new wife soon realizes something is wrong with him.

Title: 88. In Love and War
description: In 1944, the family lives of three San Francisco Marines are affected by their personal experiences on the front lines in the Pacific and vice-versa.

Title: 89. Carry on Sergeant
description: Sergeant Grimshawe wants to retire in the flush of success by winning the Star Squad prize with his very last platoon of newly called-up National Servicemen. But what a motley bunch they turn out to be.

Title: 90. Crash Landing
description: Airplane passengers prepare for a crash landing in the ocean.

Title: 91. The Whole Truth
description: A movie executive is framed for the murder of his beautiful promiscuous leading lady by her jealous, estranged husband.

Title: 92. The Last Hurrah
description: Frank Skeffington is an old Irish-American political boss, running for re-election as mayor of a U.S. town for the last time.

Title: 93. Carve Her Name with Pride
description: During World War II, a recently widowed young woman is recruited to work as a spy in France.

Title: 94. The Colossus of New York
description: A brilliant surgeon encases his dead son's brain in a large robot body, with unintended results...

Title: 95. It Happened in Broad Daylight
description: Having doubts about the guilt of the obvious suspect in the murder of an eight year old girl, a police detective decides to investigate the case on his own.

Title: 96. The Hunters
description: In 1952, during the Korean War, two American pilots become bitter enemies over the same woman but must shelve their personal feud when confronted by deadly Chinese MIG fighter jets in battle.

Title: 97. From the Earth to the Moon
description: In 1868, American inventor Victor Barbicane develops a powerful military explosive that he also uses as fuel for a moon-bound rocket manned by himself and a motley crew.

Title: 98. The Buccaneer
description: During the War of 1812, Louisiana buccaneer Jean Lafitte assists the Americans in defending New Orleans against the attacking British war fleet.

Title: 99. Monster on the Campus
description: The blood of a primitive fish exposed to gamma rays causes a benign research professor to regress to an ape-like, bloodthirsty prehistoric hominid.

Title: 100. The Reluctant Debutante
description: While visiting her father, an American teenage girl is thrown into London society during its "Debutante Season."

Title: 101. The Barbarian and the Geisha
description: In 1856, the first U.S. Consul General to Japan encounters the hostility of the local authorities and the love of a young geisha.

Title: 102. The Left Handed Gun
description: After his employer is murdered by rival cattlemen, a troubled and uneducated young cowboy vows revenge on the murderers.

Title: 103. Frankenstein's Daughter
description: Dr. Frankenstein's insane grandson attempts to create horrible monsters in modern-day L.A.

Title: 104. Mädchen in Uniform
description: In a strict Prussian boarding school for girls, sensitive student Manuela von Meinhardis develops a forbidden love to one of her teachers, the compassionate Elisabeth von Bernburg.

Title: 105. The Gift of Love
description: Fearing she will die, a physicist's wife hopes her husband will be consoled by the orphan she adopts.

Title: 106. The Screaming Skull
description: A newly-wed woman believes the ghost of her husband's deceased first wife is haunting her at an eerie Southern mansion.

Title: 107. The Music Room
description: Depicts the end days of a decadent zamindar (landlord) in Bengal, and his efforts to uphold his family prestige even when faced with economic adversity.

Title: 108. Gunman's Walk
description: A powerful rancher always protects his wild adult son by paying for damages and bribing witnesses, until his crimes become too serious to rectify.

Title: 109. China Doll
description: A boozing Army Air Corps Captain falls in love with an Asian beauty he has unknowingly bought.

Title: 110. The Revenge of Frankenstein
description: Having escaped execution and assumed an alias, Baron Frankenstein transplants his deformed underling's brain into a perfect body, but the result proves to be mortally perilous.

Title: 111. She Demons
description: Heroic, but dull, Fred Maklin and beautiful, but spoiled, Jerrie Turner wash up on an uncharted tropical island. They are soon captured by ex-Nazi Colonel Osler, who also has imprisoned a bevy of beauty contest winners whom he allows to be whipped by his slavering Nazi storm troopers. He has, you see, been extracting some glandular substance from the girls to inject into his wife Mona, who suffered terrible facial disfigurement, in efforts to restore her beauty. Things get worse as the island is used for test bombing by the US Air Force.

Title: 112. The Cry Baby Killer
description: A teenage boy panics and takes hostages when he thinks he's committed murder.

Title: 113. Westbound
description: In 1864 Capt. John Hayes goes to Colorado to take over the stagecoach line and keep the flow of Western gold flowing and help the North win the Civil War.

Title: 114. Rally 'Round the Flag, Boys!
description: All about the citizens of Putnam's Landing and their reactions to an Army missile base in their backyard.

Title: 115. The Remarkable Mr. Pennypacker
description: In early-1900s Pennsylvania, Mr. Pennypacker has two company offices--and two families with a combined total of 17 children. With an office in Harrisburg and an office in Philadelphia, he has successfully kept two separate homes. However, when an emergency requires his oldest son to find him, Mr. Pennypacker's dual life is revealed.

Title: 116. The Key
description: During World War II, successive tugboat British Captains sent on dangerous salvage missions pass-on the key to a home-port apartment, where a lonely Swiss-Italian young war-widow lives.

Title: 117. The Law and Jake Wade
description: Marshal Jake Wade aids outlaw Clint Hollister escape jail but Clint wants to know where Wade hid an old hold-up loot taken while both men were outlaws in the same gang.

Title: 118. The Quiet American
description: A young naive American and a cynical older British diplomat disagree over politics in 1952 Vietnam and over a beautiful young native girl.

Title: 119. The Horse's Mouth
description: An ill-behaved, lovably scruffy painter, Gulley Jimson, searches for a perfect canvas, determined to let nothing come between himself and the realization of his exalted vision.

Title: 120. Buchanan Rides Alone
description: Texan Tom Buchanan is heading back home with enough money to start his own ranch, but when he stops in the crooked town of Agry, he's robbed and framed for murder.

Title: 121. Nowhere to Go
description: In London, a Canadian serving prison time for grand theft escapes prison and attempts to retrieve his loot, kept in a bank safety deposit box, but his accomplice takes the security key while he only has the pass code.

Title: 122. Cairo Station
description: A newspaper salesman at the train station in Cairo develops an unhealthy obsession with a woman who sells refreshments.

Title: 123. The Idiot
description: In the carriage of a train heading to St. Petersburg, Prince Lev Nikolaevich Myshkin, who returns to Russia after four years of treatment in a Swiss sanatorium, meets the wealthy merchant Parfyon Rogozhin. From him, Myshkin first hears about a certain Nastasya Filippovna Barashkova, a former kept woman of the nobleman Totskiy.

Title: 124. H-8...
description: A bus and a truck are destined to collide with each other on a highway. Their passengers go on about their lives without knowing what will happen.

Title: 125. Teenage Cave Man
description: A young man defies tribal laws and searches for answers. The result of his quest yields knowledge of past generations.

Title: 126. Giants and Toys
description: In the middle of a fierce commercial competition among three caramel companies, an executive builds up a ditzy teenage girl as a mascot while simultaneously trying to uncover the rival companies' plans.

Title: 127. Chalti Ka Naam Gaadi
description: Three woman-hating brothers face changes in their respective lifestyles when two of them fall in love.

Title: 128. The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
description: After inadvertently stopping an Indian attack on his stagecoach while traveling in the American West, an English gentleman finds himself appointed sheriff of a nearby town.

Title: 129. The Brain Eaters
description: The inhabitants of a small Illinois town begin disappearing after a strange cone is found sticking out of the ground nearby.

Title: 130. The Beatniks
description: A young singer's chance at fame is threatened by his hoodlum pals.

Title: 131. The Sheepman
description: A brash stranger and his sheep arrive in a small town, but not soon after, the townspeople decide they've seen enough of him.

Title: 132. Ambush at Cimarron Pass
description: In 1867, a Yankee patrol joins forces with a group of ex-Confederate soldiers in order to cross Apache territory and reach the nearest fort.

Title: 133. High School Confidential!
description: A tough kid comes to a new high school and begins muscling his way into the drug scene. This is a typical morality play of the era, filled with a naive view of drugs, nihilistic beat poetry, and some incredible '50s slang.

Title: 134. The Snorkel
description: Although the police have termed her mother's death a suicide, a teenage girl believes her step-father murdered her.

Title: 135. Christine
description: Vienna in 1906: Frantz Lobheimer has just broken off the discrete love affair he was having with the baroness Eggersdorf, now that he's discovered true love with the young and tender Christine.

Title: 136. The Man Who Died Twice
description: Nightclub owner T.J. Brennon dies in a car accident and two narcotics agents are killed in his apartment, prompting an investigation by the local police aided by Brennon's cop brother.

Title: 137. The Son of Robin Hood
description: The son of Robin Hood dons his father's famous tights. Unfortunately, he's nowhere near as good as his father was so the merry men look for Robin's other child.

Title: 138. Corridors of Blood
description: Dr. Thomas Bolton fights for the use of anesthetic in surgery and uses himself as a guinea pig, but soon finds himself addicted.

Title: 139. Lonelyhearts
description: Eager for a job, journalist Adam White accepts the lowly position of columnist for the advice-giving section of the Chronicle but he often clashes with his cynical editor, Shrike.

Title: 140. Gang War
description: A Los Angeles high-school teacher's problems begin when he happens to witness a gangland killing and agrees to identify the murderers. Not realizing this will cause the underworld to retaliate "big time".

Title: 141. The Sign of Zorro
description: A masked vigilante battles a corrupt commandant by night while masquerading as an aristocrat by day.

Title: 142. Lafayette Escadrille
description: American youth and flying ace flies for France in World War I, meets and loves a French girl and a prostitute.

Title: 143. Desire Under the Elms
description: Desperation and secret passions on a family farm lead to tragedy.

Title: 144. Ride a Crooked Trail
description: Fugitive bank robber Joe Maybe assumes the identity of a dead marshal when he rides into a town whose judge asks Joe to act as town marshal but an old flame almost betrays his real identity forcing Joe to claim she's his wife.

Title: 145. Montparnasse 19
description: Chronicling the last year of the life of Modigliani, an Italian painter living in abject poverty in Paris who falls in love with Jeanne, a girl from a wealthy family whose parents do not approve of him.

Title: 146. Lake of the Dead
description: A group of friends travel to a cabin in the Norwegian forest. It's a rumor that at night a crazy man can be heard screaming at a lake nearby the cabin.

Title: 147. Equinox Flower
description: A businessman clashes with his elder daughter over her choice of a husband.

Title: 148. Wind Across the Everglades
description: An ornithologist battles a family of bird poachers in the Florida Everglades.

Title: 149. The Badlanders
description: Released from the Yuma Prison in 1898, ex-killer John McBain wants to go straight while ex-robber Peter Van Hoek seeks revenge, and their destinies eventually converge in the mining town of Prescott.

Title: 150. Desert Patrol
description: Sent to destroy a German petrol dump in the North African desert, a British commando team unexpectedly discovers a large German tank unit, and must inform headquarters in time.

Title: 151. Ten North Frederick
description: After her father's funeral, Ann Chapin thinks back over the last five years of his life, years of apparent political and personal failure dominated by a selfish and dissatisfied wife, eased only by alcohol. But it starts to emerge that he had in fact one brief and unsuspected period of happiness and love.

Title: 152. Curse of the Faceless Man
description: Calcified Pompeii gladiator kidnaps a scientist's girlfriend in modern-day Naples, Italy.

Title: 153. Mannekäng i rött
description: Model at prestigious fashion house murdered. Blackmail revealed as motive. Kajsa Hillman, employed there, uncovers potential killers. More deaths follow as culprit covers tracks.

Title: 154. Bullwhip
description: In order to avoid the hangman's noose, a cowboy agrees to marry a beautiful but fiery redhead.

Title: 155. Daddy-O
description: A singing truck driver meets a feisty blonde who challenges him to a drag race. When he is offered a new job that also includes drug running, he must fight to save his friends and himself.

Title: 156. The Ballad of Narayama
description: A kabuki theatre-inflected story about a poor village whose people have to be carried to a nearby mountain to die once they get old.

Title: 157. War of the Colossal Beast
description: Glenn Manning, "The Amazing Colossal Man," believed dead after falling from the Hoover Dam, reemerges in rural Mexico, brain damaged, disfigured, and very hungry.

Title: 158. Marjorie Morningstar
description: At 18, Marjorie Morgenstern is the proverbial New York Jewish-American princess on the cusp of womanhood. While she has in the back of her mind that she would like to become a stage actress, she is less certain about her personal future. Although she has burgeoning sexual feelings for her boyfriend Sandy Lamm, a nice Jewish boy whom she is expected to marry eventually, she isn't sure if she truly loves him. She wants some time away to discover whether she should accept his marriage proposal; in doing so, she meets several wannabe-suitors who will enter, leave, and re-enter her life during her young adulthood. The one she believes that she is truly in love with is Noel Airman, 14 years her senior, who is social director of South Wind, a summer resort in the Catskills, when they first meet. Much like Marjorie's chosen life path is against the tradition envisioned by her opinionated mother, Rose Morgenstern, who hopes that acting is just a phase and Marjorie will settle into the life of a homemaker and mother, Noel has taken a similarly unconventional life path, bucking an envisioned professional life for one in the arts; he is adored as a genius by those at South Winds as he is writing a Broadway play. What those at South Winds do not see is Noel's time away from South Winds; he has a tendency to not finish what he starts, which might be one reason he never sees himself getting married. What Rose might find more egregious about Noel as Marjorie's potential husband is the fact that he turned his back on his Jewish heritage. As Noel contemplates settling into a more conventional life with Marjorie, can the love they think they have for each other overcome these obstacles?

Title: 159. The Philosopher's Stone
description: An underpaid middle-aged clerk finds a 'parash pathar', a stone that changes iron to gold on touch.

Title: 160. Anna Lucasta
description: A young woman struggling with a sordid past finds that her biggest enemy had larger demons than she did.

Title: 161. The Square Peg
description: A British road repairman gets into a feud with the army, gets drafted, and is mistakenly parachuted into German-occupied France where his physical resemblance to the local German commandant triggers a hilarious chain reaction.

Title: 162. Never Love a Stranger
description: Following the life of an orphan and the events that change his life and lead him into a life of crime.

Title: 163. The Geisha Boy
description: Gilbert Wooley is a second-rate magician who is sent to entertain the troops in the pacific. During his time in Japan he becomes attached to a little orphan boy.

Title: 164. Another Time, Another Place
description: An American war correspondent falls in love with a BBC reporter, but their relationship seems doomed from the start.

Title: 165. Madhumati
description: A young man takes shelter in a mansion when a landslide blocks his route to the railway station. Then, he finds the mansion familiar and soon learns about the story of his previous birth.

Title: 166. The Matchmaker
description: Thornton Wilder's tale of a matchmaker who desires the man she's supposed to be pairing with another woman.

Title: 167. War of the Satellites
description: An "unknown force" declares war against planet Earth when the United Nations disobeys warnings to cease and desist in its attempts at assembling the first satellite in the atmosphere.

Title: 168. Terror in a Texas Town
description: A Swedish whaler is out for revenge when he finds out that a greedy oil man murdered his father for their land.

Title: 169. Step Down to Terror
description: A killer on the lam takes refuge in his childhood home where his mother and widowed sister-in-law are ignorant of his criminal past.

Title: 170. Varan
description: Original Japanese version. Research in the Tohoku region comes across a monster known to the locals as the mountain god Baradagi.

Title: 171. Return to Warbow
description: After 11 years on a chain-gang, stagecoach robber Clay Hollister escapes prison and heads to the town where his brother hid the loot but the sheriff's posse is after him.

Title: 172. The Mugger
description: A police psychiatrist attempts to find a mugger obsessed with the need to seek out lonely women and slash their faces.

Title: 173. Space Master X-7
description: A fungus brought from space threatens to grow and spread, devouring everyone in its path.

Title: 174. Live Fast, Die Young
description: Two teen sisters leave their no-good father for a lurid life on the road.

Title: 175. Giant from the Unknown
description: A very large, degenerate, Spanish conquistador is freed from suspended animation by lightning and goes on a killing spree in a small town.

Title: 176. Fort Dobbs
description: Eluding a sheriff's posse, an escaped man saves a farming family from a Comanche attack and escorts it to the nearby Fort Dobbs.

Title: 177. The H-Man
description: When a narcotics deal goes sour and a suspect disappears, leaving only his clothes, Tokyo police question his wife and stake out the nightclub where she works. His disappearance stumps the police - until a young scientist appears who claims that H-Bomb tests in the Pacific, evidenced by a "ghost ship" that has turned up in the harbor, have created radioactive creatures - "H-Men" - who ooze like slime and dissolve anyone they touch.

Title: 178. The True Story of Lynn Stuart
description: When the nephew and his friend of Phyllis Carter are killed in an automobile crash while under the influence of narcotics, she persuades Police Lieutenant Jim Hagan to use her as an undercover agent, despite the fact she is married and has a young son. She is trained to impersonate "Lynn Stuart", who did time for a bank hold-up, and is given a job at a drive-in restaurant where members of a narcotics gang are known to frequent. She attracts the attention of Willie Down, a mid-level boss in the gang and begins getting information from him which she passes on to the FBI. Her husband, alarmed over the health of their son gets her to promise to quit. Willie takes her to Mexico before she can inform anyone where she is going, where he and a gang henchman murder the driver and guard of a truck transporting dope and hijack the load. Phyllis/Lynn goes to the ladies room of a service station where she scribbles their destination on a mirror using lipstick hoping to be rescued.

Title: 179. Home Before Dark
description: Simmons is magnetic as Charlotte, her lovely, delicate face reflecting the inner turmoil of a woman battling for sanity after she walks out of a mental institution.

Title: 180. The Female Animal
description: An aging film star and her alcoholic daughter compete for a handsome extra.

Title: 181. The Roots of Heaven
description: In French Equatorial Africa, an idealist ecologist starts a campaign of public awareness to help save the African elephants from extinction.

Title: 182. Ni vu, ni connu
description: In a small French village, everything would be quiet if the local wildlife cop was not being ridiculed by a smart poacher.

Title: 183. The Hideous Sun Demon
description: After exposure to radiation, an atomic research scientist finds himself changing into a murderous, lizard-like creature every time he is exposed to sunlight.

Title: 184. A Certain Smile
description: Dominique, a law student at the Sorbonne, is engaged to a fellow classmate. Unfortunately, she's more attracted to his philandering Uncle Luc, who's married to the charming Françoise. Dominique and Luc begin a tawdry affair.

Title: 185. The Black Orchid
description: Anthony Quinn and Sophia Loren star as longtime widower Frank and recently widowed Rose, lonely hearts who discover something special in The Black Orchid, a sensitive comedy romance directed by Martin Ritt (Norma Rae, Murphy's Romance).

Title: 186. The Space Children
description: An alien intelligence aborts the launching of a rocket with the help of a bunch of children.

Title: 187. Torpedo Run
description: A submarine commander is forced to blow up a Japanese ship with prisoners.

Title: 188. The Day the Sky Exploded
description: Scientists discover that a group of meteors are hurtling on a collison course with Earth, and if they hit, the planet will be destroyed.

Title: 189. Hot Spell
description: A housewife is doing her best to keep her family together as it's slowly falling apart, a fact she's trying to ignore. Her cheating husband's birthday party is approaching and many lines will be crossed after that event.

Title: 190. The Female
description: Handsome and rich Spanish gentleman abandons his wife and riches for his love of a young girl of poor stock who taunts and degrades him. Only after she has humbled him mercilessly does she offer him her love in the end.

Title: 191. Attack of the Puppet People
description: Lonely, deranged puppet-master designs a machine that shrinks people.

Title: 192. Tamango
description: A Dutch slave captain, on a voyage to Cuba, faces a revolt fomented by a newly captured African slave, Tamango. The slaves capture the captain's mistress, forcing a showdown.

Title: 193. Underworld Beauty
description: Released from prison, a gangster (Michitaro Mizushima) retrieves diamonds sought by fellow yakuza.

Title: 194. Too Much, Too Soon
description: The daughter of iconic actor John Barrymore becomes reunited with her father after a ten year estrangement and engages in his self-destructive lifestyle.

Title: 195. The Night Heaven Fell
description: Ursula leaves the convent where she was educated, to start living with her uncle, the count Ribera, and her aunt Florentine. When she arrives, she is confronted with a local drama: a youngman from the village, Lambert, whose sister took her own life, accuses the count of being responsible for his sister's death, for having sexually assaulted her. The two men have a duel of honour, in which Lambert is severely wounded, and the count's honour is saved. Ursula acts as a nurse to Lambert, and falls in love with him, only to find out that Lambert is secretly her aunt's lover. One night, the count too, finds out his wife's affair, and again the two men fight, this time Lambert kills the count. Ursula helps him to escape. Florence, mad with jealousy and hatred for her niece, sets the police after him.

Title: 196. The Last Day of Summer
description: A young man meets a middle-aged woman at a deserted beach. Will they overcome their personal and wartime traumas and find a way to stay together?

Title: 197. Back to the Wall
description: A wealthy industrialist discovers his wife is having an affair and decides to exact revenge by blackmailing her under an assumed identity.

Title: 198. Le Beau Serge
description: After long absence, a man returns to his hometown only to find his best friend has become an alcoholic.

Title: 199. The Fiend Who Walked the West
description: In this western remake of Kiss of Death (1947), a convicted bank robber serving his sentence, and wishing nothing more than to finish his time and get back to his family, gets involved with a psychotic, homicidal inmate who turns on him and winds up terrorizing his wife and murdering his friends.

Title: 200. Invention for Destruction
description: An evil millionaire named Artigas plans to use a super-explosive device to conquer the world from his headquarters inside an enormous volcano.

Title: 201. Blood of the Vampire
description: In 1870s Transylvania, scientist Dr. Callistratus is put to death by villagers who wrongly believe he's a vampire. However, his horribly disfigured henchman, Carl is on hand to orchestrate a life-saving heart transplant.

Title: 202. Summer Love
description: A neighborhood rock band gets a job playing at a summer camp.

Title: 203. Apache Territory
description: A no-nonsense drifter leads a ragtag collective surrounded by a deadly tribe of Apaches.

Title: 204. Brink of Life
description: Three women in a maternity ward reveal their lives and intimate thoughts to each other, where they face the choice of keeping their babies or offering them for adoption.

Title: 205. From Hell to Texas
description: After ranch hand Tod Lohman accidentally kills the son of a powerful rancher, he panics and flees, but the rancher and his vengeful crew hunt Tod down.

Title: 206. The Lone Ranger and the Lost City of Gold
description: Three Indians are murdered. Each was wearing a medallion when he died. Together the medallions form a puzzle whose solution points to gold.

Title: 207. The Tunnel of Love
description: A series of misunderstandings leaves a married man believing that he has impregnated the owner of an adoption agency, and that she will be the surrogate for him and his wife.

Title: 208. Eroica
description: Two sketches covering episodes from the World War II. In the first novel, "Scherzo alla polacca", a shrewd son, trying to preserve his skin, ultimately becomes a hero and finds a reason for fighting. He initially tries to avoid underground training to avoid the Warsaw uprising. His drunkenness, disregard for safety and cowardice when sober stated with humorous effect come out as something sane in the world gone mad. His will to survive is more acceptable than any desire for heroic death. The second novel, "Ostinato lugubre", details a hopeless attempt at escape from a prison camp by a man who can no longer stand the confinement and idiocy of the professional soldiers trying to keep up the military preneses in prison. Nevertheless, his escape boosts the morale of his fellow prisoners, while the "escapee" lies hidden from Germans and comrades alike."

Title: 209. Raw Wind in Eden
description: On a small Mediterranean island live Costanza, her father Urbano, and beachcomber Moore, whom she plans to marry. Into this Eden come two plane crash survivors, supermodel Laura and her playboy friend Wally. The shapely, worldly Laura becomes a bad influence, especially when triangles start to develop. But beyond this, little mysteries lead Laura and Wally to wonder what's going on and who Moore really is.

Title: 210. I Bury the Living
description: Cemetery director Robert Kraft discovers that by arbitrarily changing the status of plots from empty to occupied on the planogram causes the death of the plots' owners.

Title: 211. Frankenstein 1970
description: Needing money, the last member of the Frankenstein family leases his family's castle out to a film company as he tries to continue his ancestor's gruesome experiments to create life.

Title: 212. Cry Terror!
description: Duped by former Army pal Paul Hoplin into building a time bomb, New York shop owner Jim Molner and his family become hostages of Hoplin who uses bomb threats to extort money from airlines.

Title: 213. The Perfect Furlough
description: Army psychologist Lt. Vicki Loren oversees Corporal Paul Hodges when he is sent to Paris with young movie star Sandra Roca as a vicarious rest cure for all 103 of his sex-starved colleagues, who are building a radio base in the Arctic.

Title: 214. The Haunted Strangler
description: A researcher investigating a notorious serial killer who was hanged 20 years earlier seemingly becomes possessed by the long-dead strangler.

Title: 215. The Fearmakers
description: A Korean War veteran returns to Washington D.C. only to discover his business partner had died and their public-research business sold, so he works there undercover to find out the truth.

Title: 216. Violent Road
description: Truck drivers take cargo of explosives over bumpy mountain road.

Title: 217. A Matter of Dignity
description: A daughter discovers her wealthy family is actually on the verge of bankruptcy and decides to charm a millionaire for his money in marriage. Soon she is torn between living a lie and keeping up appearances.

Title: 218. Vagabonderne paa Bakkegaarden
description: A world wanderer, who pays for food and coffee with a song, returns to the farm in Denmark he first worked at and fell in love with the farmer's daughter. She's now a widow and mother and her evil brother-in-law is running the farm.

Title: 219. The Vampire's Coffin
description: Graverobbers stumble upon the tomb of a vampire, who turns them into zombies to do his bidding, which is to stalk and capture beautiful women.

Title: 220. Tank Force
description: During World War II in North Africa, an American sergeant serving with the British 8th Army is captured by the Germans but he hatches various plans of escape from the POW camp.

Title: 221. I Married a Woman
description: Advertising executive Marshall Briggs finds his work in conflict with his love-life with fashion model Janice Blake.

Title: 222. One Life
description: Normandy, second half of the nineteenth century. Jeanne Dandieu lives in a manor house with her parents and their servant Rosalie. She gets to know Julien, a handsome man, whom she soon marries. Her happiness is short-lived as she finds out that not only has Julien married her for her money but he cheats on her as well, with Rosalie to crown it all. The latter gives birth to a baby girl before leaving the house. Six years later, Julien has a new mistress, Gilberte de Fourcheville. Jeanne puts up with this new ordeal bravely. However Gilbert's husband surprises the two lovers in a caravan and, in a rage, hurls them over the edge of a cliff.

Title: 223. The Missouri Traveler
description: During the early 1900s, a runaway Missouri orphan reaches a town where the townsfolk are enchanted with him and where a wealthy rancher and a local newspaperman compete to give him an education.

Title: 224. Macabre
description: A doctor's daughter is kidnapped and buried alive, and he is given just five hours to find and rescue her.

Title: 225. Terror from the Year 5000
description: Scientists build a time machine to snatch objects from the past. But little do they know that 20th-century objects put in the machine seem to be "traded" for analogous future objects by intelligent life.

Title: 226. The Lost Missile
description: A strange missile from outer space circles the Earth at low altitudes, destroying everything in its path.

Title: 227. Fast and Sexy
description: A beautiful, wealthy widow leaves New York to find herself a husband in the Italian village in which she was born. After many tries she...chooses the village blacksmith.

Title: 228. Confessions of a College Student
description: At the idea of and with the assistance of her drama-loving detective-novel reading friend, penniless and desperate So-yeong cons a congressman into believing she is his lost daughter. As So-yeong completes her studies in law school, the suspicious congressman's wife does a little detective work of her own. So-yeong, racked with guilt, is determined to become a lawyer who helps women in similar situations as hers, but will she succeed? Or will the truth be revealed?

Title: 229. La création du monde
description: A comedy about the creation of the universe in six days, with the devil messing around and contributing in his own way.

Title: 230. St. Louis Blues
description: The story of W. C. Handy, the undisputed father of the blues.

Title: 231. The Last of the Fast Guns
description: On a mission to find a missing man in Mexico, gunfighter Brad Ellison learns that life is not as simple as it used to be.

Title: 232. The Light in the Forest
description: A young white man who spent his whole life raised by Native Americans is sent to live with his birth family and must learn to fit in with people he was taught to hate.

Title: 233. La violetera
description: In the year 1899, Soledad makes her living peddling violets in the streets of Madrid. Her life changes when she meets and falls in love with Fernando, an aristocrat who is engaged to a countess. When Fernando announces his intention to marry Soledad, the affair becomes a social scandal.

Title: 234. Maracaibo
description: In Venezuela during the 1950s, a vacationing Texas oilman is asked to help extinguish an oil derrick fire and he succumbs to the charms of a visiting New York novelist.

Title: 235. Chase a Crooked Shadow
description: At Kimberley Prescott's villa, a stranger shows up and claims he is her brother who supposedly died the previous year in a car accident.

Title: 236. Die grünen Teufel von Monte Cassino
description: In 1944, German paratroopers must defend the Monte Cassino area of Italy from Allied attacks while artifacts from the nearby historical abbey are evacuated to the Vatican by army trucks.

Title: 237. The Saga of Hemp Brown
description: Lieutenant Hemp Brown's army payroll wagon is robbed by ex-sergeant Jed Givens' gang, forcing Brown to search for the culprits after he is deemed a coward by the court martial.

Title: 238. The Gun Runners
description: The Cuban misadventures of a Florida smuggler, at the time of the Cuban Revolution.

Title: 239. The Naked Maja
description: Love takes precedence over art and politics as Spanish painter Goya pines for an aloof duchess.

Title: 240. Cattle Empire
description: Released from prison, a trail boss is solicited by rival cattle barons to drive their respective cattle herds to Fort Clemson.

Title: 241. Rosemary
description: West Germany in '50s is becoming an economic superpower. In such climate, Rosemarie is just one of many enterpreneurs who wants her piece of new fortune. She uses her charms to bring members of West German industrial elite to her bed. There she finds business secrets and later sells them to French competition. However, when scandal errupts, Rosemarie would find that she can't beat the system.

Title: 242. The Robot vs. The Aztec Mummy
description: A mad doctor builds a robot in order to steal a valuable Aztec treasure from a tomb guarded by a centuries-old living mummy.

Title: 243. Kings Go Forth
description: Toward the end of World War II, two American soldiers fighting in Southern France become romantically involved with a young, American woman. Her background will reveal more about them than her.

Title: 244. Girl with an Itch
description: A lonely, widowed middle-aged ranch owner gives a ride to a sexy blonde hitchhiker, When she finds out about the ranch he owns, she figures that he'll be an easy mark, but his suspicious son could spoil her plans.

Title: 245. The Noose
description: One day in the life of an alcohol addict. With the help of his girlfriend Krysia, Kuba attempts to regain control of his life. But when she's at work, Kuba is home alone, and it becomes hard not to resist the temptation.

Title: 246. The Silent Enemy
description: During WW2, Italian Navy divers use underwater chariots to mine the keels of British warships, forcing the British to send underwater demolition expert Lionel Crabbe and his team to counter these enemy actions.

Title: 247. The Bride and the Beast
description: When Laura and Dan get married, she's more interested in Dan's gorilla. It's revealed through hypnosis that she was Queen of the Gorillas in a previous incarnation.

Title: 249. The Camp on Blood Island
description: Deep in Malaya, as World War II is rapidly coming to an end, men, women and children, trapped by the Japanese invasion, are held captive in the Blood Island prison camp. Knowing that Yamamitsu, the sadistic commandant, will murder them all when he learns of his country's defeat, Dutch, a Dutch planter, smashes the camp radio. British officer Lambert and, in the women's prison, the recently-widowed Kate, join Dutch in arming the prisoners.

Title: 250. Be Beautiful But Shut Up
description: Orphaned 18-year-old girl joins jewel smugglers, falls for policeman, marries him, complicating her criminal involvement.

Title: 251. Merry Andrew
description: A downtrodden but creative English school teacher (Danny Kaye) on an archaeological trip, discovers the joys of love and circus life with acrobat (Pier Angeli).

Title: 252. Showdown at Boot Hill
description: A deputy marshal kills a murderer in a town that loved him, and when no one is willing to identify him, he can't collect any reward.

Title: 253. Panda and the Magic Serpent
description: The adventures of a cute little panda, a dragon god and an evil serpent.

Title: 254. Bachelor of Hearts
description: German scholar Wolf Hauser arrives for a year at Cambridge. Apart from his studies he tries to muck in with the very English non-academic goings-on while romancing pretty Girton girl Ann.

Title: 255. The Woman Eater
description: A mad scientist captures women and feeds them to a flesh-eating tree, which in turn gives him a serum that helps bring the dead back to life.

Title: 256. The Man Upstairs
description: Wilson, in pain and sleepless, threatens others with a gun at his boarding house. After hitting Pollen and refusing help from Mrs. Harris, police clash with Dr. Sanderson over how to handle the armed, confused man.

Title: 257. Fort Massacre
description: A cavalry troop finds itself under constant attack by Indians.

Title: 258. Saddle the Wind
description: Former gunslinger Steve Sinclair is now a peaceful rancher, but things go wrong after his wild brother Tony arrives with his new gun--and his new fiancée, former saloon girl Joan Blake.

Title: 259. Submarine Seahawk
description: For his first command in the Pacific war a by-the-book officer is ordered to take his submarine on a reconnaissance mission to locate a fleet of Japanese fighting ships the Allies have lost track of. At first, the rest of the crew resent his distant manner and the way he keeps avoiding taking on the Japs.

Title: 260. The Possessors
description: Noël Schoudler is the head of a wealthy and powerful family in France. He manages his financial and commercial concerns with an iron grip, leaving little room for his son François to prove himself.

Title: 261. Darby's Rangers
description: The lives, loves, and battles of fictional characters in the Army's First Ranger Battalion during WWII.

Title: 262. This Happy Feeling
description: On a stormy night, young woman asks another guest at party to rescue her from her lecherous boss and take her to the train station. After her rescuer suggests that she stop at his place to get out of her wet clothes, she dashes from his car. The door she knocks on for help is the home of a retired actor and there she spends the rest of the night. He makes no passes and next morning she discovers the young man who drove her from party is his next door neighbor. The two men compete for her affections. Older man's zany live-in housekeeper and a seagull she has rescued provide comic relief.

Title: 263. Solva Saal
description: A woman elopes with her boyfriend but finds that he has ditched her and made off with her family heirloom. Now she, alongwith a helpful news reporter, have to retrieve the necklace and get back to her home within the span of a single night.

Title: 264. Kala Pani
description: Based on A.J.Cronin's 'Beyond This Place', this movie narrates the story of an untiring crusade for justice. A young man, learning about his father's wrongful implication in a fifteen-year-old murder, vows to bring the true criminals to justice and release his innocent father from 'kaala paani' (life imprisonment), for which he enlists the help of a press reporter, a retired police inspector and an unwitting prostitute who happens to possess some key evidence.

Title: 265. The Moonraker
description: After the battle of Worcester at the end of the Civil War, the main aim of Oliver Cromwell's Commonwealth is to capture Charles Stuart. The future king's escape depends on the intrepid Earl of Dawlish.

Title: 266. Styrmand Karlsen
description: First mate Knud Karlsen has just received sad news from his girlfriend. On board the ship is also chef Valdemar, sailor Ole, owner's confident son Robert and a whole bunch of eager sailors. On board develops the drama out every minute, culminating in the film's climax, when a fire breaks out on board

Title: 267. My World Dies Screaming
description: A newlywed is terrified when her husband brings her to live in the old house that figures in her recurring nightmare.

Title: 268. Tarawa Beachhead
description: A Marine sergeant falls in love with the widow of a comrade shot in combat by their lieutenant.

Title: 269. Lydia Ate the Apple
description: Pawel and Lidka are from different worlds but they somehow meet each other in a night club. He's a young lad from a wealthy family, she's an attractive dancer. They fall in love and go out of town but their happiness doesn't last long.

Title: 270. Taxi, Trailer and Corrida
description: A chaotic family go on holiday to Spain and get mixed up with a gang of diamond thieves

Title: 271. Les Misérables
description: Jean Valjean, convicted of a minor crime, spends the rest of his life being pursued by a cruel and unrelenting policeman, Javert.

Title: 272. Dublin Nightmare
description: Loot goes missing in robbery double-cross. Gang members, an ex-lover and a handsome stranger are left to sort it out.

Title: 273. Khalid ibn el Walid
description: The story of Khalid Ibn Al-Walid (592-642) the greatest military leader in the dawn of Islam during the life of prophet Muhammad and his caliphs Abu Bakr and Omar.

Title: 274. The Rickshaw Man
description: A poor rickshaw driver finds himself helping a young woman and her son after the woman's husband dies suddenly.

Title: 275. Howrah Bridge
description: Prem Kumar, a businessman from Rangoon, travels to Calcutta to try and track down his brother's murderer and recover a priceless family heirloom.

Title: 276. Day of the Badman
description: Judge Jim Scott must contend with the vicious relatives of a murderer he's about to sentence...and his unfaithful fiancee.

Title: 277. Me and the Colonel
description: Jacobowsky, a refugee, and Prokoszny, a Polish colonel, flee Nazis despite conflicting views. Vying for a woman's affection, they learn to respect each other while outwitting pursuers.

Title: 278. Violent Playground
description: The struggle between a Liverpool Juvenile Liaison officer and a dangerous young pyromaniac.

Title: 279. Tempest
description: In 18th century Russia, Imperial officer Piotr Grinov is dispatched to a faraway isolated outpost where his loyalties are tested during the Pugachev Rebellion against the Empress Catherine II.

Title: 280. Post Box 999
description: Mohan is a young man who lives with his widowed mother, is in love with a young woman named Shyama, and both would like to get married. Unfortunately, before that could happen, Shyama is shot dead, the police get involved, an eye-witness named Bindiya names Mohan as the killer, as such Mohan is arrested, tried in Court, found guilty and sentenced to be hanged. The only one who believes in Mohan's innocence is his mother, Gangadevi. She advertises in the newspapers offering a reward of Rs.10,000/- to whoever can prove her son innocent, asking readers to direct their responses to Post Box 999. No one ever responds, until after 5 years when a Reporter, Vikas, of "Prakash" publications comes across the ad and decides to prove Mohan innocent. Assisting him are Gangadevi and a young woman named Nilima, eventually both Nilima and Vikas fall in love. Their investigation take them to a variety of people, including Banarsilal, Bindiya who witnessed the killing, and a killer named Shamsher Singh, who abducts Nilima. Now Vikas has only one day to prove Mohan's innocence, and he must use it to either do that or save Nilima from Shamsher's clutches.

Title: 282. The Wind Cannot Read
description: During World War II, a British officer stationed in India is recruited by Army Intelligence and tasked with learning Japanese to interrogate Japanese P.O.W.s, and he falls in love with his pretty Japanese teacher, Sabby.

Title: 283. The Party Crashers
description: An unruly teenage gang led by Mark Damon gets their kicks by crashing square teen parties around town. At an innocent teen gathering, Damon charms rich spoiled brat Connie Stevens into accompanying him to a motel party and she drags along her decent young date (ex-child star Bobby Driscoll). While there, Damon discovers his alcoholic mother (Doris Dowling), who falls down a flight of stairs while struggling to get away from her son. Along the way, the kids' parents provide the viewer with insight about their children's troubled lives. The final film of both Farmer and Driscoll before they moved to television work.

Title: 284. The Strange World of Planet X
description: A friendly visitor from outer space warns against conducting experiments with the Earth's magnetic field, that could mutate insects into giant monsters.

Title: 285. She Gods of Shark Reef
description: Two brothers, one wanted for murder, are shipwrecked on an island inhabited by nubile young women who have amassed a valuable cache of pearls.

Title: 286. The Restless Years
description: High-school life and the prejudices and moral values of small-town USA during the 1950s.

Title: 287. Andy Hardy Comes Home
description: Andy Hardy, now a grown man with a wife and children, returns to his hometown on a business trip and finds himself getting mixed up in local politics.

Title: 288. Windjammer: The Voyage of the Christian Radich
description: Windjammer, the first presentation in CINEMIRACLE, is the record of a training cruise of the full-rigged S/S Christian Radich from Oslo across the Atlantic, through the Caribbean, to New York and back home again.

Title: 289. Aphrodite, Goddess of Love
description: The construction of great temple dedicated to the goddess Aphrodite, followed by new and high taxes and the arrival of a plague, create discontent in the population, and threatens the love between a sculptor and a slave.

Title: 290. Eva Wants to Sleep
description: A young female student arrives in a new city, and finds herself in a confusing situation: there is no place for her for sleeping. An incredible odyssey through the endless maze of night streets is ahead.

Title: 291. Tank Battalion
description: Four men in their tank, during the Korean War in 1951, find themselves behind enemy lines.

Title: 292. Letter from Siberia
description: A witty examination of life and culture in Siberia.

Title: 293. I Accuse!
description: In 1894 France, a Jewish officer in the French Army is falsely accused of spying for Germany.

Title: 294. Tread Softly Stranger
description: An irresistible temptress causes trouble between two brothers after the more handsome, charismatic one turns up, leading to robbery and death.

Title: 295. Voice in the Mirror
description: Jim Burton has become a chronic alcoholic since the death of his young daughter, and is cared for by his hard-working wife. A doctor's warning that Jim could become mentally ill strikes enough fear into him that he really wants to cure himself, but he can't. One night, he meets William Tobin, a fellow drunk, and finds that he helps himself by trying to help Tobin. Thus is born, amid setbacks, a group resembling Alcoholics Anonymous.

Title: 296. Orders to Kill
description: American agent faces an engrossing moral dilemma when he is parachuted into France to eliminate a suspected traitor in the French Resistance.

Title: 297. Blitzmädels an die Front
description: During WWII The German 'Wehrmacht' is heavily under fire after the invasion of Normandy. There are also a lot of women participating in the war, working at the front line as couriers for the air force. In this war, everyday, they put their lives on the line.

Title: 298. Our Virgin Island
description: Two newlyweds buy a small private island in the British Virgin Islands and live a happy life without the comforts of modern society.

Title: 299. Mardi Gras
description: Military school cadet Boone wins a date with a French movie goddess (Carère) who happens to be the queen of the Mardi Gras parade. They fall in love, but Carère's movie studio wants to capitalize on this newly found love for publicity.

Title: 300. Moi, un noir
description: A life of Nigerien immigrants in Abidjan, Ivory Coast within a week.

Title: 301. Soldaterkammerater
description: Every year, thousands of young men are summoned to undergo an education where completely different demands are made than in civilian life. The soldiers must be in perfect physical form and they must learn to deal with modern weapons.

Title: 302. Cop Hater
description: The hardworking detectives of the 87th Precinct in an unnamed city during a massive heat wave investigate the seemingly random murders of policemen.

Title: 303. Blind Spot
description: A blind American Army officer becomes involved in a murder mystery and solves it after regaining his sight.

Title: 304. The Case Against Brooklyn
description: Fact-based story of a rookie cop who takes on a crime syndicate involved in corrupting government officials in Brooklyn, New York.

Title: 305. 12 O'Clock
description: Bani Chowdhury and solicitor Ajoy Kumar are deeply in love with each other. But their world comes crashing down when Bani's cousin, Maya is found dead in the first class compartment at a railway terminus in Bombay. Bani who had gone to the station to receive Maya, is charged with the murder. A distraught Ajoy with the help of his assistant Motilal Sharma begins to comb the country for every available clue. And just when everything seems lost he gets a breakthrough.

Title: 306. This Angry Age
description: During the 1950s, in French Indochina, the Dufresne family struggles to survive amid harsh economic times and natural disasters.

Title: 307. The Electronic Monster
description: An insurance investigator finds there's more to electronic dream therapy than meets the eye.

Title: 308. Onionhead
description: In 1941, an Oklahoma college graduate joins the US Coast Guard and serves as a cook on a ship based in Boston.

Title: 309. Quantrill's Raiders
description: A Civil War guerilla gang plans an attack on a Kansas arsenal.

Title: 310. The Deep Six
description: Called to active duty during World War II, U.S. Navy Reserve lieutenant Alec Austin struggles to do his military duties while observing his Quaker beliefs, to the dismay of his comrades.

Title: 311. Sea Fury
description: Off the Spanish coast, two tug-boat captains are caught in a violent feud over a woman but their rivalry is set aside when a sinking freighter carrying explosives must be salvaged and towed to port.

Title: 312. Black Cat Mansion
description: The descendant of the servant of a cruel and vicious samurai returns to the town where she was born, only to find that a cat who is possessed by the spirits of those murdered by the samurai is trying to kill her.

Title: 313. The Bonnie Parker Story
description: In the 1930s, amoral blonde tommy-gun girl Bonnie Parker cut a swath of bodies across the South-West. Starting out on gas stations and bars with side-kick Guy Darrow she graduated to bank hold-ups with Darrow's brother and, after bloodily springing him, her jailed husband. But there was never any doubt who was in charge.

Title: 314. The Cool and the Crazy
description: High school thug is front man for a local marijuana ring.

Title: 315. Kommunist
description: A devoted struggle for better life.

Title: 316. Conflagration
description: Follows Mizoguchi, an aspiring Buddhist monk who became involved in the temple that was owned by his father. Through a series of flashbacks, framed as a police interrogation, Mizoguchi unravels the story of his obsession with the temple beginning with his childhood.

Title: 317. The Doctor's Dilemma
description: A single doctor about to be awarded a knighthood for his claim of curing tuberculosis is infatuated by a woman's beauty and charm, promising to save her husband's life, only to change his mind after discovering the man's immoral character.

Title: 318. Jailor
description: A disfigured but compassionate and dedicated Jailor's life undergoes changes after his wife leaves with another male.

Title: 319. The Year Long Road
description: The plot is set in an underdeveloped and remote area of a fictitious country, where the locals try to build an asphalt road in spite of careless attitude of the Government. The story follows the adventures in their self-reliant mission that lasts a whole year.

Title: 320. Tarzan's Fight for Life
description: A doctor calls on Tarzan to topple the native witch doctor whose black magic remedies are killing patients.

Title: 321. Fräulein
description: A Nazi's fiancée helps an escaped U.S. soldier, then meets him in postwar Berlin.

Title: 322. The Loyal 47 Ronin
description: Japan's timeless tale of honor and revenge, the Loyal 47 Ronin is the true story of group of samurai who became ronin (masterless samurai) after their Lord was forced to commit seppuku (ritual suicide) for assaulting a court official, Kira Yoshinaka, who had insulted him. After patiently waiting and planning for over a year, they executed a daring assault on Lord Kira's estate, and exacted their revenge, in the full knowledge that they would themselves be forced to commit seppuku to atone for their crime.

Title: 323. Girls on the Loose
description: Vera (Mara Corday) runs a nightclub that's really a front for her secret operation: an all-female crime ring that's been pulling off heist after heist. The gang does a major job with the help of Agnes (Abby Dalton), a new recruit and insider with access to a bank's payroll. But then the nervous Agnes threatens to squeal, so Vera has her rubbed out. And when Vera's good-girl sister, Helen (Barbara Bostock), starts dating suspicious policeman Bill (Mark Richman), Vera gets really cutthroat.

Title: 324. Tonka
description: The remarkable and ironical story of a wild colt that changes owners around the time of the Great Sioux War of 1876.

Title: 325. Missiles from Hell
description: A group of Polish fighters of the Polish resistance movement go on a mission to destroy the German V-1 'Flying Bomb' at Peenemünde and cripple the German war effort during World War II.

Title: 326. Naked in the Night
description: (1958) Eva Bartok, Alexander Kerst, Sabine Sesselmann, Heinz Drache. Just what you've always wanted to see,a dubbed into English German exploitation quickie about the evils of loose women. Won't they ever learn. From 35mm.

Title: 327. Yahudi
description: A vengeful Jew adopts an abducted Roman child, who grows up and unknowingly falls in love with a Roman.

Title: 328. The Night Affair
description: A vice inspector for the Paris police takes special interest in the plight of drug-addicted Lucky whom he considers to be more victim than criminal.

Title: 329. Dragstrip Riot
description: After a run-in with a tough motorcycle gang, where Rick Martin (Gary Clarke) is blamed when one of the bikers is sent out of control over a cliff, he and his girl are threatened and pursued. On to the beach riot, where the real culprit is unmasked and retaliates with his spear gun.

Title: 330. Fanfare
description: After a fight the brass band in a small village splits up into two separate bands. They both want to win a contest and will do anything to prevent the other band from winning it.

Title: 331. Twilight for the Gods
description: The sailing vessel Cannibal has a leaking hull. The captain (Rock Hudson) reluctantly changes course for Honolulu, where one passenger (Cyd Charisse) is wanted by the law. The water rising, everyone struggles against nature to survive.

Title: 332. The Man Who Wouldn't Talk
description: A barrister (Anna Neagle) tries to defend her client, a U.S. scientist (Anthony Quayle), for killing his bride (Zsa Zsa Gabor), a U.S. spy.

Title: 333. Floods of Fear
description: Two inmates working to shore up a dike during a severe flood are swept away in the current along with their guard. The three of them wind up in an isolated house whose flooded interior contains a frightened woman.

Title: 334. A Woman Possessed
description: John and Ann want to marry but John's possessive mother is a bit overbearing and jealous. How far will mother go to come between them?

Title: 335. Der Arzt von Stalingrad
description: After the battle of Stalingrad, battalions of German prisoners were taken to concentration camps. To the 5110/47 comes the military medical Fritz Böhler. He tries to improve the prisoners' conditions, sometimes risking his life.

Title: 336. Teenagers Battle the Thing
description: Archaeology students uncover a prehistoric manster... part man, part monster, and all bad attitude with a cheap costume.

Title: 337. Le joueur
description: The game was his curse.

Title: 338. Invisible Avenger
description: Lamont Cranston, aka The Shadow, investigates the murder of a New Orleans bandleader.

Title: 339. Alive and Kicking
description: Three elderly ladies tire of living in an old people's home and when they heard that they are about to be separated, they make a bid for freedom. They escape to an island off the Irish coast and are about to occupy a group of cottages when the owner, an Irish millionaire, just returned from making his fortune in America, appears on the scene.

Title: 340. Enchanted Island
description: Two 19th-century sailors jump ship only to discover their tropical paradise is a cannibal stronghold.

Title: 341. A Cry from the Streets
description: A welfare worker becomes emotionally involved with her charges, a group of adorable, homeless orphans. Music by Larry Adler. (1959; B&W)

Title: 342. Elephant Gun
description: Brothers compete for a woman's affection while danger lurks at every turn in an African wild game park.

Title: 343. The Mirror Has Two Faces
description: A teacher runs an ad in the newspaper to find a wife. Afraid of beautiful ladies, he weds an ugly woman. After a car accident, he meets a doctor who offers to reveal his wife's beauty.

Title: 344. Die Trapp-Familie in Amerika
description: The von Trapp family are struggling to survive in America, where their performances of European church music are not popular with the audiences. Only when they start performing more upbeat Austrian folk songs and even some American numbers do they become a success and finally find security and a new home.

Title: 345. Les tricheurs
description: Bob Letellier, a good looking rich kid who studies science, makes the acquaintance of Alain, a cynical and immoral young man. The latter introduces him to the existentialist circles of Saint-Germain-des-Prés. Bob is invited to a party and becomes Clo's lover, a rich heiress.

Title: 346. The Law Is the Law
description: Assola is an imaginary village on the border between Italy and France and the borderline crosses the village itself. The French customs agent Ferdinand is always trying to catch the Italian smuggler Giuseppe. Giuseppe discovers that Ferdinand was actually born in Italy and therefore he can't be a French customs agent.

Title: 347. Damen i svart
description: Private detectives Mr and Mrs John Hillman visits a friend in the country. While there they track down a murderer who is disguised as a ghost.

Title: 348. Love on the Riviera
description: It is Summer. It is the right time for love, especially in a most romantic place as Golfo del Tigullio. Different stories: Dorina looking for a rich lover; Clara who takes a fancy to the young Walter while her daughter Lina tries to save her; Aristarco who gave up his career to follow Ada's, but who likes Jacqueline; Renata who is offered by her husband to Ferrari to get money; Marcello who, extraditing Micheline to France, misses the train and falls in love with her.

Title: 349. Mogli pericolose
description: Federico, Bruno, Pirro and Benny are married. The first three have beautiful wifes, Benny instead is married to a ugly woman. Ornella is Bruno's wife, she is very jealous and maintains that all men are deceitful, granted the opportunity, while Claudine, Federico's wife, maintains the contrary point of view. So they bet that Tosca, a former dancer, will succeed in seducing Federico. Troubles for everyone.

Title: 350. Rusty Knife
description: Two friends who witnessed an organized crime murder are threatened by the local mob into keeping quiet.

Title: 351. El castillo de los monstruos
description: A couple are forced to stay in a scary castle, and the castle is filled with monsters!

Title: 352. White Wilderness
description: The wildlife of the Arctic is explored in this true-life adventure.

Title: 353. Juvenile Jungle
description: A planned kidnapping goes awry when the gang leader falls for the victim.

Title: 354. Unwed Mother
description: Betty (Norma Moore) moves from a farming community to Los Angeles. She falls into the clutches of a super-cad (Robert Vaughn) and ends up abandoned and pregnant. After visiting a drunken abortionist, she decides to give the baby up for adoption, but has a change of heart. The climax is a classic of melodrama from a master of melodrama, Walter Doniger, director of TV's "Peyton Place."

Title: 355. 3 straniere a Roma
description: Three girls from Milan dreaming of a holiday in Rome arrive in the city by train and decide to pretend to be rich Danish girls to attract three nice guys... Three guys looking for easy-going girls offer them a guided tour through the most beautiful places of the city. The girls accept and make the guys spend a fortune, but one evening they get drunk and one of them incidentally reveals she's just from Milan. The guys get upset and set up a sort of revenge, but in the end they make it up. One of the very first movies with Claudia Cardinale in a leading role.

Title: 356. The Gypsy and the Gentleman
description: Belle (Melina Mercouri) is a tempestuous Gypsy girl who is after Sir Paul Deverill (Keith Michell). Her plan is to marry him and take him for every cent he has before moving on to other lovers.

Title: 357. The Flower in Hell
